title: One Year Of 'Tumbbad': Makers Release Unseen Footage, Plan To Turn The Film Into A Franchise
text:
It’s hailed as the modern day classic. Anyone who has watched Tumbbad was in awe of the film for its intriguing story-line and excellent use of graphics. So much so, that when India’s Oscar entry was announced, people thought Tumbbad would have made a better choice.

Twitter

Did you know it took more than six years to make the mind-bending film. Tumbbad has indeed been one of its kind films to have come of Indian cinema. It has been a year since the movie released and went on to become a sleeper hit.

Twitter

Celebrating the film’s one year anniversary, the makers have released some unseen footage from the movie.

Unaware that India had got independence, Vinayak takes Pandurang to the market wherein he buys an ice cream for him and tells him to have it. Actor-producer Sohum Shah, who was also seen in Netflix's Bard Of Blood, recently said that he wants to make franchise out of Tummbad.

"We had said we will make a prequel or sequel but nothing is decided yet as we are yet to crack a story. I don't want to look at it the business thing just because one part has done well, so make the second one.

Twitter

“We should get the right script, then we will start. It can be a story of Hastar or Pandurang. We want to make a franchise. The idea was there at the time when we were making 'Tumbbad'. We want to do it because it is a beautiful universe and has such good characters and more films should be made in this space. Nothing is difficult if you make it with passion," Sohum told PTI.

On the first anniversary of the movie, the actor-producer arranged for a screening of Tumbbad. Talking about the journey, Sohum Shah said, "When I look back at the journey I find it amazing. It took six to seven years to make this film and today we have completed one year of the film. It was our dream to get our film release. It feels good to see the kind of response we had got. I am satisfied. I have made this film with a lot of love, I have not made it in a hurry. I have dedicated a lot of time so I don't want to make any changes to the film, it is a perfect film."
